definitions: short chain of amino acids linked by peptide bonds forming a molecular unit
examples: The peptide hormone insulin regulates blood sugar levels throughout the body
Scientists synthesized a new peptide to target cancer cells specifically

definitions: one part in every hundred used to express ratios and proportions
examples: Interest rates rose by three percent this quarter
The survey showed ninety percent approval for the new policy

definitions: rate or proportion expressed as a fraction of one hundred
part or share considered in relation to the whole
examples: The percentage of students passing increased significantly this year
Calculate the percentage change between these two values carefully
He takes a percentage of every sale made through referrals
What percentage of the profits goes to charity annually

definitions: value below which a given percentage of observations in a data set falls
examples: Her test score placed her in the ninety-fifth percentile nationally
The child's height falls in the seventieth percentile for her age

definitions: ability to see, hear, or become aware through the senses
way of regarding, understanding, or interpreting something mentally
examples: His perception of colors changed after the accident occurred
The drug altered her perception of time and space dramatically
Public perception of the company improved after the scandal ended
Their perception of the situation differed from the actual facts

definitions: branch or bar on which birds rest or roost
freshwater fish with spiny fins found in rivers and lakes
old unit of length equal to five and a half yards
examples: The eagle surveyed the valley from its rocky perch above
She installed a wooden perch in the parrot's cage yesterday
They caught several perch during their morning fishing trip
The restaurant serves fresh perch with lemon butter sauce daily
The field measured exactly forty perches along its eastern boundary
Old property deeds often listed dimensions in perches and rods

definitions: slow movement of liquid through a porous material or filter
examples: The percolation of rainwater through soil layers takes several days
Coffee percolation produces a stronger brew than drip methods

definitions: musical instruments played by striking, shaking, or scraping to produce sound
medical diagnostic technique of tapping body surfaces to assess underlying structures
examples: The percussion section includes drums, cymbals, and xylophones primarily
She studied percussion at the conservatory for four years
The doctor used percussion to check for fluid in the lungs
Chest percussion helps loosen mucus in respiratory therapy sessions

definitions: musician who plays drums and other percussion instruments professionally
examples: The percussionist kept perfect time throughout the jazz performance
She hired a percussionist for the wedding band ensemble

definitions: state of eternal punishment and damnation in religious belief systems
examples: The preacher warned of perdition for those who strayed from righteousness
Medieval paintings often depicted souls falling into perdition below

definitions: fast-flying bird of prey with pointed wings and distinctive markings
examples: The peregrine falcon dives at speeds exceeding two hundred miles hourly
Conservation efforts helped save peregrines from extinction in many regions

definitions: plant that lives for more than two years continuously
something that persists or recurs year after year
examples: These perennials bloom every spring without needing replanting annually
The garden center specializes in hardy perennials for cold climates
Budget deficits remain a perennial problem for the state government
The perennial debate about education funding continues every legislative session

definitions: verb tense expressing completed action relative to another time reference
examples: The present perfect connects past actions to present relevance effectively
Students often struggle with the past perfect tense in English

definitions: state or quality of being perfect, complete, or without defect
examples: She pursued perfection in every aspect of her artistic work
The diamond's perfection made it extremely valuable to collectors

definitions: refusal to accept any standard short of perfection in oneself or others
examples: Her perfectionism often delayed project completion by weeks or months
Perfectionism can lead to anxiety and decreased productivity over time

definitions: person who refuses to accept any standard short of perfection
examples: The perfectionist spent hours adjusting minor details nobody would notice
Being a perfectionist makes it difficult to delegate tasks effectively

definitions: grammatical aspect that expresses a completed action or state in linguistics
examples: Russian verbs distinguish between perfective and imperfective aspects systematically
The perfective aspect indicates the action reached its natural endpoint

definitions: series of small holes punched in material for easy separation
abnormal opening in organ or tissue caused by disease or injury
examples: The perforation along the coupon edge makes tearing easier
Check the perforation before separating the ticket stub carefully
The patient suffered intestinal perforation requiring emergency surgery immediately
Ulcer perforation constitutes a serious medical emergency requiring immediate intervention

definitions: act of presenting entertainment to an audience through various mediums
action or process of carrying out or accomplishing a task
way in which machine or system functions under given conditions
examples: The theater performance received standing ovations every night this week
Her performance of the concerto demonstrated exceptional technical mastery
Employee performance reviews happen annually in most corporate environments
The team's performance exceeded all expectations this quarter significantly
The car's performance improved after the engine tune-up yesterday
System performance degrades when memory usage exceeds ninety percent

definitions: person who entertains an audience through acting, singing, or other talents
examples: The street performer gathered a large crowd with juggling tricks
Professional performers spend years perfecting their craft and stage presence

definitions: arts involving public presentation including theater, music, and dance
examples: She studied performing arts at the prestigious conservatory downtown
The performing arts center hosts concerts and plays year-round

definitions: fragrant liquid typically made from essential oils for personal use
pleasant distinctive smell especially of flowers or other natural sources
examples: She dabbed perfume on her wrists before the evening gala
The boutique sells exclusive French perfumes at premium prices
The perfume of roses filled the garden on summer evenings
Spring perfume from blooming trees drifted through open windows

definitions: person who creates and produces perfumes professionally in the fragrance industry
examples: The master perfumer blended rare essences to create signature scents
Famous perfumers train for years to develop their olfactory skills

definitions: art and business of making and selling perfumes and fragrances
shop or department where perfumes are sold to customers
examples: She studied perfumery in Grasse, the world capital of fragrance
Modern perfumery combines traditional techniques with synthetic chemistry
The department store's perfumery offers hundreds of designer fragrances
Visit our perfumery for personalized fragrance consultation services today

definitions: outdoor garden structure with vertical posts supporting crossbeams and open lattice
examples: Climbing roses covered the wooden pergola creating natural shade below
They built a pergola over the patio for outdoor dining

definitions: point in orbit where celestial body is nearest to Earth
examples: The moon appears larger at perigee than at other orbital points
Satellites experience increased atmospheric drag when passing through perigee

definitions: point in planet's orbit when it is nearest to the sun
examples: Earth reaches perihelion in early January despite winter temperatures
Mercury's perihelion advances slightly each orbit due to relativistic effects

definitions: serious and immediate danger threatening harm or loss
examples: The climbers faced mortal peril when the storm struck unexpectedly
Ships navigating these waters face peril from hidden rocks below

definitions: continuous line forming the boundary of a closed geometric figure
distance around the edge of a shape or area
examples: Security guards patrol the perimeter of the military base continuously
The fence marks the perimeter of the property clearly
Calculate the perimeter by adding all side lengths together
The rectangle's perimeter equals twice its length plus twice width

definitions: length or portion of time with particular characteristics
punctuation mark (.) used to end declarative sentences
monthly discharge of blood from uterus in reproductive years
division of school day for instruction in particular subject
examples: The Renaissance period produced extraordinary advances in art and science
This warranty covers a period of two years from purchase
Place a period at the end of each complete sentence
The abbreviation needs a period after each letter properly
She tracks her period using a mobile health application
Menstrual periods typically last between three and seven days
Math class takes place during third period every weekday morning
Students have seven periods in their daily schedule currently

definitions: magazine or newspaper published at regular intervals throughout the year
examples: The library subscribes to dozens of academic periodicals annually
This periodical publishes new issues every quarter without fail

definitions: quality of occurring at regular intervals or periods in time
examples: The periodicity of comet appearances helps astronomers predict returns
Chemical elements show periodicity in their properties across the table

definitions: person who travels from place to place especially for work
examples: The peripatetic salesman covered three states every month consistently
Peripatetic teachers serve multiple rural schools throughout the district

definitions: external device connected to computer for input or output functions
area at the edge or boundary of something
examples: Connect the peripheral devices before installing their driver software completely
The store sells computer peripherals including printers and scanners
Development spread to peripheral areas outside the city center
Peripheral regions often lack access to essential services unfortunately

definitions: outer limits or edge of an area or object
examples: Small shops clustered around the periphery of the market square
Vision problems first appeared at the periphery of her visual field

definitions: optical instrument with mirrors for observation from concealed position
examples: The submarine's periscope broke the surface to scan for ships
Children built a simple periscope using mirrors and cardboard tubes

definitions: food or goods likely to decay or spoil quickly
examples: Store perishables in the refrigerator immediately after shopping trips
The grocer donated perishables to the food bank before closing

definitions: trailing plant with blue or purple flowers grown as ground cover
small edible sea snail with spiral shell found on rocky shores
pale blue color with slight purple tint
examples: Periwinkle spreads quickly to cover bare ground in shaded areas
The garden path was bordered with blooming periwinkle plants
Children collected periwinkles from tide pools during low tide
The restaurant serves periwinkles as a seafood appetizer specialty
She painted the nursery walls a soft periwinkle shade
The bridesmaid dresses were periwinkle to match spring flowers

definitions: criminal offense of deliberately lying under oath in legal proceedings
examples: The witness faced perjury charges for lying during the trial
Committing perjury can result in significant fines and imprisonment

definitions: extra benefit supplementing salary provided by employers to employees
examples: Company perks include free gym membership and lunch daily
The job's perks made up for the modest base salary

definitions: chemical treatment to give hair permanent waves or curls
examples: She gets a perm every six months to maintain curly hair
The salon specializes in perms and other chemical hair treatments

definitions: thick subsurface layer of soil that remains frozen throughout the year
examples: Climate change causes permafrost to thaw releasing stored carbon dioxide
Building on permafrost requires special foundation techniques to prevent settling

definitions: state or quality of lasting or remaining unchanged indefinitely
examples: The monument symbolizes the permanence of their cultural heritage
Digital storage questions the permanence of written records today

definitions: job or position that continues indefinitely without fixed end date
hairstyle created by chemical treatment producing lasting waves or curls
examples: After two years of contracts, she finally got a permanent position
The company converted several temporary workers to permanent status
The stylist recommended a loose permanent for natural-looking waves
Her permanent lasted six months before needing another treatment

definitions: degree to which material allows liquids or gases to pass through
examples: Soil permeability affects drainage rates and plant growth significantly
The membrane's permeability to oxygen maintains cellular respiration properly

definitions: authorization or consent especially formal or official to do something
examples: Students need written permission to leave campus during school hours
The app requests permission to access your location data

definitions: official document giving authorization to do something specific legally
examples: The building permit allows construction to begin next month
Fishing permits are required for all lakes in this region

definitions: way in which set of things can be ordered or arranged mathematically
examples: Calculate all possible permutations of these four different elements
The permutation formula helps solve complex probability problems efficiently

definitions: chemical compound containing oxygen-oxygen single bond used for bleaching and disinfecting
examples: Hydrogen peroxide effectively disinfects minor cuts and wounds safely
Hair stylists use peroxide to bleach hair before coloring

definitions: line or plane at right angle to another line or surface
examples: Draw a perpendicular from point A to the base line
The walls stand perpendicular to the foundation ensuring structural stability
